author: ARIA Cybersecurity Solutions

commands.description: Creates a rule that drops all packets that match the specified 5-tuple values.
commands.name: aria-block-conversation

commands.description: Deletes a named rule from the 5-tuple logic block. This allows the previously blocked conversation to resume.
commands.name: aria-unblock-conversation

commands.description: Creates a rule that redirects a conversation that matches 5-tuple values to the Packet Recorder. Packets are tagged with the VID specified in the instance.
commands.name: aria-record-conversation

commands.description: Removes the named rule from the 5-tuple block. This stops redirecting traffic to the Packet Recorder.
commands.name: aria-stop-recording-conversation

commands.description: Adds a rule that generates an alert when a conversation that matches the specified 5-tuple values is detected.
commands.name: aria-alert-conversation

commands.description: Removes a named rule from the 5-tuple logic block, disabling the alerts.
commands.name: aria-mute-alert-conversation

commands.description: Creates a rule that blocks packets destined for one or more specified ports.
commands.name: aria-block-dest-port

commands.description: Removes a named rule from the destination port logic block. This allows the previously blocked traffic to resume.
commands.name: aria-unblock-dest-port

commands.description: Adds a rule that redirects traffic that is destined for one or more ports to the Packet Recorder. Packets are tagged with the VID specified in the instance.
commands.name: aria-record-dest-port

commands.description: Removes a named rule from the destination port logic block. This stops redirecting traffic to the Packet Recorder.
commands.name: aria-stop-recording-dest-port

commands.description: Creates a rule that generates an alert when traffic destined for one or more ports is detected.
commands.name: aria-alert-dest-port

commands.description: Removes a named rule from the destination port logic block, disabling the alerts.
commands.name: aria-mute-alert-dest-port

commands.description: Adds a rule that blocks packets originating from one or more specific ports.
commands.name: aria-block-src-port

commands.description: Removes a named rule from the source port logic block. This allows the previously blocked traffic to resume.
commands.name: aria-unblock-src-port

commands.description: Adds a rule that redirects traffic originating from one or more ports to the Packet Recorder. Packets are tagged with the VID specified in the instance.
commands.name: aria-record-src-port

commands.description: Removes a named rule from the source port logic block. This stops redirecting traffic to the Packet Recorder.
commands.name: aria-stop-recording-src-port

commands.description: Creates a rule that generates an alert when traffic originating from one or more ports is detected.
commands.name: aria-alert-src-port

commands.description: Removes a named rule from the source port logic block, disabling the alerts.
commands.name: aria-mute-alert-src-port

commands.description: Adds a rule that blocks packets destined for a specific IP address or range of IP addresses.
commands.name: aria-block-dest-subnet

commands.description: Removes a named rule from the destination subnet logic block. This allows the previously blocked traffic to resume.
commands.name: aria-unblock-dest-subnet

commands.description: Creates a rule that redirects traffic destined for a specific IP address or range of IP addresses to the Packet Recorder. Packets are tagged with the VID specified in the instance.
commands.name: aria-record-dest-subnet

commands.description: Removes a named rule from the destination subnet logic block. This stops redirecting traffic to the Packet Recorder.
commands.name: aria-stop-recording-dest-subnet

commands.description: Creates a rule that generates an alert when traffic destined for a specific IP address or range of IP addresses is detected.
commands.name: aria-alert-dest-subnet

commands.description: Removes a named rule from the destination subnet logic block, disabling the alerts.
commands.name: aria-mute-alert-dest-subnet

commands.description: Adds a rule that blocks packets originating from a specific IP address or range of IP addresses.
commands.name: aria-block-src-subnet

commands.description: Removes a named rule from the source subnet logic block. This allows the previously blocked traffic to resume.
commands.name: aria-unblock-src-subnet

commands.description: Creates a rule that redirects traffic originating from one or more specific IP addresses to the Packet Recorder. Packets are tagged with the VID specified in the instance.
commands.name: aria-record-src-subnet

commands.description: Removes a named rule from the source subnet logic block. This stops redirecting traffic to the Packet Recorder.
commands.name: aria-stop-recording-src-subnet

commands.description: Adds a rule that generates an alert when traffic originating from a specific IP address or range of IP addresses is detected.
commands.name: aria-alert-src-subnet

commands.description: Removes a named rule from the source subnet logic block, disabling the alerts.
commands.name: aria-mute-alert-src-subnet

integration.description: The ARIA Cybesecurity Solutions Software-Defined Security (SDS)  platform integrates with Cortex XSOAR to add robustness when responding to incidents. The combination of ARIA hardware, in the form of a Secure Intelligent Adapter (SIA), and software, specifically Packet Intelligence and SDS orchestrator (SDSo), provides the elements required to react instantly when an incident is detected. When integrated with the ARIA solution, you can create playbooks that instruct one or more SIAs to add, modify, or delete rules automatically. These rule changes, which take effect immediately, can block conversations, redirect packets to a recorder or VLAN, or perform a variety of other actions.
integration.name: ARIA Packet Intelligence (Partner Contribution)

description: Manage Packet Intelligence rules in response to incidents. Instantly block conversations, redirect packets, generate alerts, or perform other actions.
name: ARIAPacketIntelligence
